results.title: Caught
results.creator_credit: Max Ophuls, Wolfgang Reinhardt and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Smith Ohrig, played by Robert Ryan, is a hedonistic, charming playboy (loosely based on Howard Hughes). Impulsively marrying ambitious, idealistic wanna-be model Leonora Eames (Barbara Bel Geddes), Ohrig keeps her a virtual prisoner in his palatial mansion, tormenting her with twisted mind games while he continues his premarital playboy activities. Coming to the realization that wealth and creature comforts are no substitute for stability, Leonora takes a job in the offices of society doctor Larry Quinada (James Mason). When Leonora finds comfort in the arms of the doctor, Ohrig becomes intent on destroying her. This is a classic film noir story of a young girl’s dream turning to nightmare.

results.title: Superhuman : The awesome power within
results.creator_credit: David Hickman, BBC and TLC Films
results.brief_description: From the makers of “The Human body” series, this ground-breaking series shows how pioneers at the cutting edge of medicine are shaping our physical future by utilising the body’s extraordinary capacity for self-repair and reinvention. “Trauma” explores what happens to the human body after exposure to trauma, such as a car crash. “Spare parts” investigates the ways of tricking the body into accepting foreign organs, such as cochlear implants. “Self-repair” explores research into growing “spare” organs to replace human body parts that wear out. “Killers into cures” looks at the very real threat of too little exposure to infection, thus allowing allergies and auto-immune diseases the most dangerous threats to health. “The Alien within” explores how cancer lives inside the body like a parasite, grows its own support system and eventually overwhelms its host. “The Baby builders” looks at the enormous advances in reproductive technology and genetics, which have allowed science to hold immense influence over the evolution of the human race.

results.title: 10 Things I hate about you = Ten Things I hate about you
results.creator_credit: Gil Junger, Andrew Lazar and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: 10 things I hate about you continues the current trend of modernizing William Shakespeare’s back catalogue, which has produced inspired rethinks like Baz Luhrmann’s vibrant disco take on “Romeo and Juliet”, Julie Taymor’s surreal interpretation of “Titus”, Michael Almereyda’s hi-tech “Hamlet” (featuring Julia Stiles) and the American high school setting of “Othello” called “O” (again featuring Julia Stiles). Not surprising then that Julia Stiles stars in this latest twist on Shakespeare’s classic opposites-attract tale, “The Taming of the shrew”. “10 things I hate about you” sticks to the original story quite closely, mostly foregoing the flowery Elizabethan dialogue for a more appropriate teen slang. Otherwise the story set up is the same, the sweet natured Bianca (Larisa Oleynik) is in love with Cameron (Joseph Gorden-Levitt) but is forbidden to date by her paranoid father unless she finds her older sister a boyfriend. Unfortunately her sister Kate (Julia Stiles) is an ill-tempered shrew whose manner towards men is hostile to say the least. Enter mysterious bad boy Patrick (Heath Ledger), who is enlisted by the desperate lovers to win over the impenetrable Kate. Cast includes Larry Miller, Andrew Keegan, David Krumholtz and Susan May Pratt.

results.title: The Battlers
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Kylie Tennant this made for television mini-series is set in Australia during the Great Depression. It focuses on the friendship between two ‘battlers’, Dancy, an orphan who has spent most of her life on the streets and Snow, a taciturn man on the rebound from a failed marriage. Forced to travel the country in search of work, like many working-class Australians of the time, and surviving mainly on dole book rations, their lives are full of hardship and deprivation, but the comradeship they develop on the road also brings them many moments of comfort and happiness. Cast includes Audine Lieth, Marcus Graham, Anne Phelan, Gary Sweet and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: Shiloh 2: Shiloh Season
results.creator_credit: Sandy Tung, Carl Borack, Dale Rosenbloom and Utopia Pictures
results.brief_description: Marty Preston (Zachary Browne) is a well-meaning 12-year-old who adopts Shiloh, a beagle who was treated cruelly by his first master, a bitter alcoholic named Judd (Scott Wilson). However, when Judd is hurt in a car accident, Marty realises Judd may have lost one of the only friends he ever had, even if he did mistreat Shiloh. With help from his parents Marty tries to get Judd back on his feet both physically and emotionally, and learns a lot of hard lessons about growing up in the process.

results.title: Runaway bride
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Robert W. Cort, Scott Kroopf, Ted Field, Tom Rosenberg, Interscope Commmunication, Lakeshore Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Richard Gere is Ike Graham, a big-city newspaper columnist who causes an uproar with an unflattering and wildly erroneous story about small-town girl Maggie Carpenter. Julia Roberts is Maggie, whose reputation for leaving prospective husbands at the altar has made her a local legend. Gere is assigned by his editor (Hector Elizondo) to write a follow-up story on Maggie, and he tracks her down to her home town in Maryland where she is spending time with her family and preparing to give marriage another try. While Ike plans to prove he was right about Maggie, and Maggie plans to even the score with Ike, nothing prepares them for the sparks that fly when they meet! Cast also includes Joan Cusack, Rita Wilson, Paul Dooley, Christopher Meloni.

results.title: The Bostonians
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: A Merchant Ivory adaptation of Henry James’ novel in which the young, but charismatic Verena is forced to choose between her loyalty to the women’s suffragette movement, represented by her mentor, Olive (Vanessa Redgrave), and the passionate attention of Olive’s cousin (Christopher Reeve) who represents everything that Olive abhors. Ruth Prawer Jhabvala adapted the novel for the screen and the film co-stars Linda Hunt and Jessica Tandy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions

results.title: Entertaining Mr. Sloane
results.creator_credit: Douglas Hickox, Douglas Kentish and Canterbury Film Productions
results.brief_description: Joe Orton’s plays eroticised the “kitchen-sink” realist theatre of the 1960s. In “Entertaining Mr. Sloane” a young man lodges with a safely bourgeois brother and sister (Harry Edwards and Beryl Reid) only to find that they are both interested in seducing him, and they will let nothing get in their way of satisfying their sexual desires. Though it is as theatre that Orton’s work is most successful, this film is still a satisfying translation of his work onto the screen. The cast is magnificent, especially the wonderful Beryl Reid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Hickox, Douglas Kentish and Canterbury Film Productions

results.title: Emmanuelle
results.brief_description: Emmanuelle is the story of a young French girl (played by Sylvia Kristel), and her transformation from shy coquette to sensuous, worldly woman through a series of erotic encounters with both friends and strangers. Newly married, Emmanuelle flys to Bangkok to join her husband, Jean, but soon succumbs to the boredom of her circumstances. When Jean encourages her to actively seek out new sexual adventures with men and women, she is momentarily taken aback. However, after being pursued by the nymphette, Marie-Ange, and seduced by her friend, Ariane, after a game of squash, Emmanuelle decides to seek out Bee (Marika Green), an archaeologist working in Bangkok, for friendship and fun. The consequences of this encounter convince her to meet with the elderly Mario (Alain Cuny), who offers to further her sexual education, promising her that he will free her from a life of moral slavery. Under his expert tuition, Emmanuelle is finally able to throw off the last vestiges of guilt, and abandon herself to the pleasures of free, unbounded sex. Advertised as “X was never like this!”, the film was a smash hit around the world. “Emmanuelle”, the first feature film by Dutch director, Just Jaekin, is the highest grossing French film of all-time, spawning six official sequels, numerous “copycat” sequels, and a French TV show. Based on the banned, scandalous 1957 novel “Emmanuelle: The Joys of a Woman”, by Emmanuelle Arsan.

results.title: Taxi
results.creator_credit: Gerard Pires, Laurent Petin, Michael Petin and ARP-TF1 Films
results.brief_description: An upbeat and entertaining film from director Gerard Pires where the tale of charismatic and grandiose Daniel, a former pizza delivery boy turned taxi driver extraodinaire, is woven into the tragi-comic life of Emilien, an unsuccessful, down trodden policeman on a near hopeless search for illusive German bank robbers. The son of a rally car driver, with driving skills that seemingly defy the realms of possibility with his speed crazy efforts in a custom modified car brimming with gadgetry, Daniel unsuspectingly picks up Emilien from his mother’s house and inevitably sets out to give him a high-speed ride. Consequently, Daniel is forced to accept a deal as a driver and assistant detective for Emilien to avoid becoming a permanent pedestrian. So, from stages of ineptitude and absurdity the investigation into the German bank robbers continues but this time with Daniel uncomfortably placed on the other side of the law but nevertheless becoming a crucial mastermind along with Emilien in the pursuit of the bank robbers. With the help of a parade of pizza delivery boys, Daniel’s trusty taxi, the amiably long suffering women in both their lives and a little messing with envious egos the unlikely pair take the uncrackable case to its longed for conclusion. Cast includes Samy Naceri, Frederic Diefenthal, Marion Cotillard and Manuella Gourary. Spoken in French with English subtitles.

With the help of a parade of pizza delivery boys, Daniel’s trusty taxi, the amiably long suffering women in both their lives and a little messing with envious egos the unlikely pair take the uncrackable case to its longed for conclusion. Cast includes Samy Naceri, Frederic Diefenthal, Marion Cotillard and Manuella Gourary. Spoken in French with English subtitles.
